intro: Dalechampia fernandesii, commonly known as the Brazilian dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its unique morphology and habitat make it a notable species in the study of neotropical flora.
